dialogues.text: TITLE: TWO DAYS AGO. Snowstorm. A single man in a rowboat the STRANGER -- forges through the icy waters toward the coast. It’s hard to say how old he is -- 20s, 40s? -- bec he’s so filthy and red-eyed and yet so fiercely driven. In shadows behind him stands the eerie, forbidding SHIP w brought him this far. Hitting the edge of the ice, the Stranger clambers out of his boat and trudges inland, smi thinly as he sees the boat drift away, no use to him anym TITLES ROLL as we follow the Stranger through the wide, e twilight of the Alaskan wilderness -- blasted by the wind persevering, too yearning and wild-eyed to slow down -- As he crests a small ridge of ice, we see a clutch of lig shimmering in the distance: BARROW, ALASKA. An Arctic out of a town, an oil and mining outpost ringed with derricks tundra. The Stranger grins as he sees Barrow twinkling through the snowstorm, and presses onward AS TITLES END -

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Strange. He faces BILLY KITKA, earnest, 40s, wearing a deputy’s ba and shining a flashlight into a snowbank west of Barrow -

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Ain’t it? Who’d do a thing like this? THEIR POV: a smoldering, eerie hole in the snow -- filled

dialogues.speaker: BURNED CELL AND SATELLITE PHONES --
dialogues.text: Eben kneels down to examine the firepit, baffled -- BILLY (cont'd) Someone got a little upset about roaming charges?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (light chuckle) I gotcha. C’mon, let’s do the sign -- (studying his friend) You okay? Eben stares out at the sun quietly, wistfully --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: STELLA

He’s tensing, realizing he doe want to be out here, heading back for the building -- When he comes across several lines of FOOTPRINTS crossing path back to the dish tower -- Quivering now, following the footprints with his flashlig Gus comes across a pair of GLEAMING BLACK EYES sizing him in the darkness --  23 24 25 16. dialogues.speaker: EBEN

dialogues.text: It’s hidden well -- He pulls at a moulding -- a ladder lowers into place. Coc the pistol, he places a foot on the rungs -- Carter’s face slowly edges into view -- shuddering with r as he sees it’s Eben down below --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm with the amber glow from the propane heater, Stella Eben huddle with the survivors reeling with shock -- Deni Doug, Beau, Carter, Lucy, Jake, Wilson and Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: How did you know about this attic, Denise?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (a beat) Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: I need the odds someone else could know about it, too.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Um. Charlie hid me here once. When his wife came home early from work. The others nod, unwilling to judge. Jake frowns, a little confused. Stella finally settles the matter --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Glad he did.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (off the canisters) How long will these things last?

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Maybe a week. Maybe a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Then what?  39.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Then we find more.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: And maybe those people give up and go elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Where are they going to go, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: (as that sinks in) I don’t think they ARE people.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (agreeing) I saw them -- feed on Helen. They wanted her blood. They’re like vampires, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Vampires are made up, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Some of them had, like, fangs.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Maybe they think they’re vampires. Maybe they filed their teeth down and they’re some sort of cult.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (fighting hysteria) They don’t fall when you shoot them!

dialogues.speaker: BEAU
dialogues.text: Hell, neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: (agreeing) Just because they’re as stubborn as Beau doesn’t make them supernatural. Look, I don’t care what they are. I just care what we do about them.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: There won’t be any help for a month.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (overlaps, despairing) Ohhhhh God --  59 60 40.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We can’t last that long -- !! Eben rises, determined to put down the growing panic --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Look. We need rest. We’1ll sleep in shifts. Measure out food. Then figure out the next step. (a breath) We have two advantages. We know Barrow. Everything, where to hide, where to attack, where to find resources. And: we know cold -- The others look to Eben, wary but hopeful because they ne hope so much, and Eben finds a bit more of his stride -- EBEN (cont'd) -- we're Alaskans. We build towns where there’s nothing but ice. We live here for a reason. Because nobody else can. OFF Stella, struck by how Eben rises to the moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE: DAY 3. The snowfall has ended; a half moon lights streets along with an incongruously glorious array of sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise punches buttons on her cellphone again and again; screen keeps reading “SEARCHING SYSTEM” -- until finally screen message changes to: “BATTERY EMPTY -- SHUTTING DOW Sighing as another hope slips away, she looks to Carter -

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Does anybody in town have, like, a ham radio or something?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Larry Cooper had one, but he moved to Dillingham. Even if we could radio somebody, they can’t get to us -- Eben tears a peephole in a window they’ve covered in tarp Stella takes a look outside. Nothing. Eben looks out himself, thinking for a moment to himself, his thoughts v before he realizes it --  61 62 41.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: If we had kids, this’d be worse. Stella stares at him quietly -- frustrated not as much by comment, as by why they fight at all. Before she can answ she’s interrupted by elderly Isaac, sitting up in confusi

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Where’s Catherine? Catherine? Eben watches in concern as Wilson kneels beside Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Mom died from lung cancer, Dad -- sixteen years back. Isaac frowns, baffled -- when a SUDDEN CRASH OUTSIDE KILL BREATH IN EVERYONE. Stella joins Eben to peer out -- EXT. STREET - NIGHT - STELLA’S POV 61 The door to a home is lying in the street -- two of Marlo creatures are visibly tearing through the place.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They’re ransacking the Clarks’ place -- tearing through everyone’s home --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group absorbs the news with dread, mentally calculati

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: All right. It’1ll take them a few days to get through all the houses --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (panics, in Eben’s face) Then they'll start ripping through the boarded-up places -- we have to move!

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: When do you suggest we do that? When won’t they be out there hunting?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We can wait here till they find us and kill us all, or we can run like hell! Some of us won’t make it, but that’s better’n all of us dying -- !  63 64 65 42.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Then you might want to wait a few more days, lose a little weight so you won't be bringing up the rear -- ! Doug SLAPS Jake hard -- which makes Eben automatically, brutally grab Doug by the neck and stare him down --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Start a fight, the noise’ll get us killed a lot faster. You want that? Doug hears, sulking. Eben’s gaze sears the point home -- he drops Doug, takes a deep breath, looks to the others - EBEN (cont'd) The Utilidor’s the strongest building in town. Its generator’s underground, it won’t make any noise. We get there, we can last the month. But it’s so far, we can’t head there till another storm gives us cover. (looks outside) The next blizzard, we'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE: DAY 6. CLOSE ON Kirsten Toomey, the daughter we me at the airport, wandering the streets -- clothing askew, bruised. She walks this way and that, terrified and lost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Wilson share a can of beets. Eben changes the propane canister. Stella, Lucy, Carter and Isaac sleep -- until they’re awakened by Kirsten’s pained voice echoing the attic --

dialogues.speaker: ANYONE
dialogues.text: Everyone tenses. Eben peels back the peephole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten keeps wandering, desperate and overwhelmed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Carter join Eben, watching in horror --

dialogues.text: We need to bring her in before they find her -- He turns to go for Kirsten, until Eben holds him --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: You think they haven't already? Carter blinks, confused. Eben points his gaze back outsid EBEN (cont'd) Watch -- CARTER’S POV -- Kirsten wanders past --

dialogues.text: I don’t want company.

dialogues.text: Beau, I’m Sheriff of this town, it’s my job to keep you all safe --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, hell of a job you've been doing. Eben stares daggers at Doug, while Stella turns to Beau -

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Listen. We have two firearms. Eben’s taking the pistol he found downstairs. We need the bigger weapon here with us, Beau. We need you here.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I shot one of them to hell, he just shrugged it off. Weapons won’t help.

dialogues.speaker: BEAU
dialogues.text: (pugnacious) Maybe YOURS won't. Beau takes a post with his shotgun by the trapdoor. Eben leans into Stella as he leaves, whispers to her --

dialogues.text: (in pain but still going)

dialogues.text: -- lost my gun --

dialogues.text: -- wouldn’ta done any good anyway --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: -- think there’s close to twenty of them, but there might as well be two hundred -- they’re watching everywhere, don’t know what they’re planning -- (the worst revelation) -- and John became one of them. Stella and Beau try to absorb this -- it can’t be true --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Nothing lives without a head. Stella watches Eben wrestling with what he’s done --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You had to.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: I may have to again -- they can turn us into them --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Oh God -- Stella and Eben wrestle with the shock -- the world is so more horrible than they ever dreamed -- as Beau examines bloodied axe soberly, eyes full of dread. Stella looks to attic with a sudden apprehension -- STELLA (cont'd) If we tell everyone, they’1ll panic --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: People deserve to know.

dialogues.speaker: BEAU
dialogues.text: And if they don’t know, they could get us killed -- they gotta get what’s at stake --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (still not sure) How do we tell them?

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: (a beat) How do we not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlow and Iris grimly examine Riis’s corpse, Marlow fing Riis’s fangs with his talon-like nails. He looks to Iris, curious -- THEY did not do this. Who could have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE: DAY 12. Jake scoops the last from a can of Deviled Ham, looks to Stella --

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t want the last? (Stella shakes her head) I used to like the little devil on these cans.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: If we can last till daylight’s back -- they didn’t show up till sundown. Maybe they can’t stand the light. It’s only two and a half weeks --  50.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (a helpless laugh) Yeah, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We can’t hold out without food -- !

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What about other houses? People might’ve left something.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: They could be hiding and living on it themselves. There were 152 folks in town. Billy and his family, Paul Jayko, the Robbinses, Adam and Jeannie: we’re not the only ones left. The others look toward the outside, considering, as Eben them a crude map he’s drawn on the back of a traffic tick EBEN (cont'd) Look. Before too long there'll be a blizzard. And when it happens, we just need to walk. (indicating on the map) Each lot in town’s twenty-five feet wide. So the general store’s two hundred seventy-five feet east. The Utilidor’s seventy-five west, then due north as far as you can go. We can hit the store for food and then burrow down in the Utilidor. (as the others absorb it) We know this town. We can walk it blindfolded. We just have to wait for the weather we’ve lived with since we were born. The survivors stir with hope; even Doug takes a breath an finds a bit of patience. Stella turns privately toward Eb taking him aside --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Hey. You know how you told me you could never be a dad? Bullshit. The way you look out for these people --

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: Don’t compliment me, you’1l just confuse me.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: It’s not a compliment. It’s an attempt to ram something through that concrete skull: you can pull off more than you think you can.

dialogues.speaker: EBEN
dialogues.text: (a beat) Not if I have to worry my wife’1l run away when we can’t work something out. They glare at each other in frustration -- not sure why e conversation between them has to end in a quarrel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE: DAY 14. CLOSE on Isaac’s rheumy, eager eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac has lowered the ladder, he’s walking downstairs -- Stella follows him with her flashlight, WHISPERING URGENT Unlike everyone else who must not speak above a hiss, Isa speaks in his normal full voice, calm and determined --

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’m walking to Wainwright --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: It’s eighty miles, there’s no way to get there. Come back upstairs -- Wilson descends the staircase, alarmed --

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Wilson! Come along, we need to get out! Bring your mother, too -- Stella holds onto Isaac before he can reach the front doo works to shake her off.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We'll die if you go out there -- !

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (angry now) NO. NO. I’LL DIE IF I STAY IN HERE -- Stella clamps a hand over Isaac’s mouth. Stella and Wilso struggle to hold Isaac back -- he wriggles and writhes un finally he CRIES, and stops resisting --  52. ISAAC (cont'd) (WHISPERING AT LAST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
